issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*Description*

Add comprehensive tracing to the {{useCreateOTPCartForCheckout}} hook to enable monitoring, debugging, and performance tracking of OTP cart creation during checkout. This will help identify issues in production and provide visibility into the OTP checkout flow.

*Background:*

* OTP cart creation is a new flow that needs observability
* Spans should capture key attributes, timing, and success/failure states
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
*Technical Notes*

*Create Span in createOTPCart Function:*

* Name span: {{'otp-checkout.create-cart'}} 

*Span Attributes to Capture:*

*Before API Call:*

* {{'product-handle'}} - The OTP product SKU
* {{'delivery-date'}} - Selected delivery date
* {{'delivery-option-handle'}} - Selected delivery option
* {{'product-count'}} - Number of unique products selected
* {{'total-quantity'}} - Total quantity of all products

*After API Call (Success):*

* {{'cart-uuid'}} - The returned cart UUID
* {{'cart-created'}} - true

*On Error:*

* {{'error-type'}} - Type of error (validation, API, etc.)
* {{'error-message'}} - Error message

*Span Status:*

* Success: {{SpanStatusCode.OK}} with message {{'OTP cart created successfully'}}
* Error: {{SpanStatusCode.ERROR}} with error message

*Follow Existing Patterns:*

* Reference {{useSavePreCheckoutProducts.ts}} (lines 56-71) for tracing pattern
* Reference {{useCreateOTPCart.ts}} in {{app/spaces/one-time-purchase}} for OTP-specific tracing
* Ensure span is ended even if errors occur (use try/finally)
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
*Acceptance criteria:*

* Span created at start of {{createOTPCart}} function
* Span named appropriately (e.g., {{'otp-checkout.create-cart'}})
* All required attributes set before API call
* Cart UUID captured in span after successful creation
* Error type and message captured on failure
* Tracing doesn't impact user experience (non-blocking)
* Traces are visible in Honeycomb
{panel}

issues.summary: [Funnel/Plans] Integrate OTP Banner logic and data fetching
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
h3. Description

Implement the business logic and data integration for the One-Time Purchase (OTP) banner component. This includes fetching user's upcoming OTP orders, determining when to show the banner, and handling the navigation to order details.

*Related UI Ticket:* GOC-3377 - [Funnel/Plans] Create OTP Banner/Entrypoint component

*Data Requirements:*

* Fetch user's upcoming one-time purchases using existing {{useCustomerOneTimeOrders}} hook
* Determine if user has any upcoming OTP deliveries
* Get order details (order ID, delivery date, order status)
* Handle loading, error, and empty states

*Business Logic:*

* Show banner only if user has an upcoming OTP order
* Banner should appear on funnel/plans and checkout pages (Delivery page and Payment page)
* Handle click navigation to OTP dashboard page
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
h3. üîß Technical Implementation Details

*Existing Hook to Use:*

* *File:* {{app/data-access/customer-orders/one-time-orders.ts}}
* *Hook:* {{useCustomerOneTimeOrders}}
* This hook already fetches the user's one-time orders - use this instead of creating new API calls

*Implementation Steps:*

# Import and use {{useCustomerOneTimeOrders}} hook in the funnel/plans page component
# Pass the relevant order data as props to the OTP Banner UI component (from GOC-3377)
# Implement conditional rendering - only show banner if upcoming orders exist
# Ensure proper integration with UI component props from [https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/browse/GOC-3377|https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/browse/GOC-3377|smart-link]
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
h3. Acceptance Criteria

h3. ‚úÖ AC1: Data Fetching & State Management

* Uses {{useCustomerOneTimeOrders}} hook from {{app/data-access/customer-orders/one-time-orders.ts}} to fetch OTP orders
* Correctly identifies if user has upcoming one-time purchase
* Handles loading state while fetching data (shows loading indicator or hides banner)
* Handles error state if hook returns

issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
Problem statement: Good Chop's net reactivation rate is the lowest among US brands, averaging 8.7% in 2025 YTD ([+source+|https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Xojo3l8QHpLdcd7t_k84egukD6_kzsG_AP5MPBALsRo/edit?gid=1626145103#gid=1626145103]), despite aggressive acquisition efforts leading to a growing pool of former customers (+25% yoy).

This initiative focuses on UI improvements with the current Reactivations page as the current page does not enable customers to do all core actions needed to adjust their delivery, and information (hierachy) is confusing

# UI is not optimized for mobile
#* lots of redundant info fitting above the fold
#* 2 CTAs
# Furthermore, we believe many customers hesitate to reactivate as they believe they will be charged immediately before having the chance to change their box delivery or their cuts. 
## There are key actions (rescheduling, changing cadence) which are not available pre-reactivation. We believe that making these available pre-reactivation will improve our net reactivation rates as customers can have confidence on when their box is coming
## There is also no reassurance on where (which step) they can select the contents of their box, and that they can still do this before getting charged
## Lastly we believe more assurance that customers still have time to cancel can improve reactivation rates
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
PRD: [https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/TNV/pages/5508857871/Initiative+Improving+Reactivations#Milestone-1%3A-Reactivations-UI-Improvements---Direct-roll-outs|https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/TNV/pages/5508857871/Initiative+Improving+Reactivations#Milestone-1%3A-Reactivations-UI-Improvements---Direct-roll-outs|smart-link] 

Design: [https://www.figma.com/design/Rvhxl1AXBYiqkZwwr16h2W/GoC--SBD-2444----Reactivation-flow?node-id=4302-4&p=f&t=PNYg3oKq0dB9GfZA-0|https://www.figma.com/design/Rvhxl1AXBYiqkZwwr16h2W/GoC--SBD-2444----Reactivation-flow?node-id=4302-4

{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
h2. *1. Initiative Objectives & Goals*

The primary objective of this initiative is to *improve the customer activation experience* by providing immediate, transparent payment feedback for their _first subscription order_.

By shifting from charging customers 4 days prior to cut-off to an immediate charge at checkout, we aim to:

* *Drastically reduce payment-related order failures:* Catching payment issues (insufficient funds, bank declines) upfront eliminates the risk of a user's first order failing days later. BAU we have on Q3 average 30% of payments failing for new customers ([source|https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Z47THI608g5dkmmKkbd20p6odbL6Q9hNq-5RQB0Kegg/edit?tab=t.0#bookmark=id.pobfs0p4o3wu]).
* *Increase customer confidence and reduce anxiety:* Users will get instant confirmation that their first order is fully paid for and secured, mirroring a standard, predictable e-commerce flow.
* *Decrease customer support overhead:* This will reduce the number of high-stress support tickets from new customers whose first orders unexpectedly fail just before their delivery date.
* *Improve activation funnel metrics:* By allowing users to _immediately_ correct a failed payment (e.g., try a different card), we will test the hypothesis that we can recover a significant portion of initially failed transactions, improving the overall payments acceptance rate.

[Expected CVA impact|https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/19fhZpcx4lnO5kO0Q1Y__OCNXP0MQOMUx3MQjM5_Erzg/edit?gid=1687350365#gid=1687350365]: + $2.5M 

----



h2. *2. Problem Statement (Status Quo)*



Currently, a new user's payment method is *only charged 4 days prior* to their selected delivery date for their first order, not when they complete the activation funnel.

This deferred model creates a high-friction, poor customer experience when a payment fails:

# A customer completes the checkout, believes their first order is confirmed, and moves on.
# Weeks or days later (4 days befor

This epic is only focusing on the Funnel work for OTP, the post-checkout work is on this other epic: [https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/browse/GOC-3059|https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/browse/GOC-3059|smart-link] 



{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*Background:* Good Chop has previously explored One-Time Purchase (OTP) options to address customer feedback about subscription hesitation and to improve reactivation rates, with past experiments showing significant short-term conversion lifts despite lower long-term retention compared to traditional subscriptions. Recognizing that many customers are skeptical of commitments and seek greater flexibility and control, the new Good Chop experience aims to expand market share by integrating on-demand purchasing as a core offering.¬†

*[MVP - Milestone 1]* *-Hacking-* *Solution*
Launch an MVP quickly to validate the business model and its impact on conversion rates. This approach will "hack" a solution without building a new, dedicated OTP endpoint.

* *Key User Experience*
*# Ability to discover and browse OTP products as a prospect on Good Chop pre-checkout funnel
*# Ability to complete checkout for OTP orders on Good Chop pre-checkout funnel
* *PRD*: [https://docs.google.com/document/d/1vZfz2cWRq-LJVHs8EYKfue42mN6lzLJFpdFEd34ZZXo/edit?pli=1&tab=t.tp5bt19rzmi|https://docs.google.com/document/d/1vZfz2cWRq-LJVHs8EYKfue42mN6lzLJFpdFEd34ZZXo/edit?pli=1&tab=t.tp5bt19rzmi|smart-link] 
* *Figma plans page*: [https://www.figma.com/design/c8UzNBNmx0cG7DVkJPhNal/GoC--SBD-2302----GoC-OTP-v2?node-id=9180-34064&m=dev|https://www.figma.com/design/c8UzNBNmx0cG7DVkJPhNal/GoC--SBD-2302----GoC-OTP-v2?node-id=9180-34064&m=dev|smart-link] 
* *Figma - other pages*: [https://www.figma.com/design/c8UzNBNmx0cG7DVkJPhNal/GoC--SBD-2302----GoC-OTP-v2?node-id=4302-8&p=f&t=uosg83ONjc2960u6-0|https://www.figma.com/design/c8UzNBNmx0cG7DVkJPhNal/GoC--SBD-2302----GoC-OTP-v2?node-id=4302-8&p=f&t=uosg83ONjc2960u6-0|smart-link]

issues.description:
Quarantined System
Spec: EditDeliveryAddress-NV.spec.ts
https://github.com/hellofresh/web/pull/62187
145 test runs, 145 test failures, 0 test retries, 0.00% test success rate

Quarantine System is a system that is used to prevent flaky tests from being executed. It is designed to be used in conjunction with the following best practices:
- Test data is not deterministic: Avoid relying solely on random values for testing. Instead, consider using deterministic test data that consistently align with the expected outcomes. This approach ensures more predictable and reliable test results.
- DOM Selector Reliability: Pay attention to the reliability of DOM selectors used in tests. Duplicate selectors or selectors that appear after a delay can lead to flaky tests. Aim to use unique and stable selectors to ensure consistent test behavior.
- Test Execution Time: Avoid making assumptions about specific times in tests. Test scenarios should be designed to handle different time frames and dynamically adapt to the current date/time. This approach increases the flexibility and resilience of the tests.
- Following the Cypress best practices https://docs.cypress.io/guides/references/best-practices

You can use the https://github.com/hellofresh/web/pull/62187 to revert the changes and add your fixes to the spec.

Find more information about the quarantined system here: https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/FI/pages/3949987114/Reduce+the+flakiness+for+web+tests

You can also reach out to the team at #good-chop-alerts or #squad-web-foundation s to discuss the quarantined system.

issues.summary: Implement new attributes in reactivation-bff call
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*Description*

Clients need to pass two new attributes to the request body of the reactivation-bff call {{reactivation-subscription/reactivate}}:

* {{cadence_start_week}}: should be retrieved from the {{nextModifiableDelvieryWeek}} value from the {{/customer/me/subscriptions}} response.
* {{cadence_interval}}: should be retrieved from the {{endlessPauseInterval}} value from the {{/customer/me/subscription}} response.

Customer impact:

* Cadence interval breaks on reactivation, when reactivation happens within a short period of time after cancellation - issue is reprodicible when reactivation happens on the same day, but it could be longer as well
* Customer is reactivated with a *weekly cadence*
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
*AC*

Ensure that these fields are correctly passed and handled in the reactivation process.
{panel}

issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*Description*

Add comprehensive tracing to the {{useCreateOTPOrderForCheckout}} hook to enable monitoring, debugging, and performance tracking of OTP order creation during checkout. This completes the observability picture for the full OTP checkout flow (cart ‚Üí order).

*Background:*

* Order creation is the final step in OTP checkout
* Critical to monitor success rates, payment failures, and performance
* Tracing helps identify issues in production quickly
* Should complement existing cart creation tracing
* Enables tracking of complete OTP checkout conversion funnel
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
*Technical Notes*

* Name span: {{'otp-checkout.create-order'}}

*Span Attributes to Capture:*

*Before API Call:*

* {{'cart-id'}} - The OTP cart UUID
* {{'customer-uuid'}} - Customer identifier
* {{'hf-public-id'}} - Customer public ID
* {{'payment-method'}} - Payment method type
* {{'has-shipping-address'}} - Boolean if shipping address ID exists
* {{'has-billing-address'}} - Boolean if billing address ID exists
* {{'has-payment-nonce'}} - Boolean if payment nonce exists

*After API Call (Success):*

* {{'order-uuid'}} - The returned order UUID
* {{'has-redirect-url'}} - Boolean if payment redirect required
* {{'order-created'}} - true

*On Error:*

* {{'error-type'}} - Type of error (validation, payment, API, etc.)
* {{'error-message'}} - Error message
* {{'failed-at'}} - Which step failed (validation, api-call)

*Span Status:*

* Success: {{SpanStatusCode.OK}} with message {{'OTP order created successfully'}}
* Error: {{SpanStatusCode.ERROR}} with error message
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
*Acceptance criteria:*

* Span named 'otp-checkout.create-order'
* All required attributes set before API call
* Order UUID captured in span after successful creation
* Error type and message captured on failure
* Tracing doesn't impact user experience
* Traces are visible in Honeycomb
* Can correlate order trace with cart trace
{panel}

Runbooks should contain the steps to follow to solve an alert/incident when triggered. It should give the firefighter/on-call person enough context and the tools to investigate a potential issue affecting our journey's critical paths.

When writing the runbook, envision a new team member whose responsibility is to investigate and resolve the issue. Provide them with sufficient context and resources. Include details that may seem obvious to you, as they can be invaluable to other team members.
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
Add a runbook on [https://github.com/hellofresh/runbooks/blob/master/troubleshooting/new-brands/good-chop|https://github.com/hellofresh/runbooks/blob/master/troubleshooting/new-brands/good-chop] for the alerts:

* [Reactivation 4xx errors|https://ui.honeycomb.io/hellofresh/datasets/traces-frontend-live/triggers/DAugQkpW26J]
* [Reactivation 5xx errors|https://ui.honeycomb.io/hellofresh/datasets/traces-frontend-live/triggers/uoWETXyXqNu]

Include

* How to save an reactivate on staging and live  
* HC queries that could help debug the issue on the FE
* Loki queries that could help debug the issue on the BE 
* How to find the owners of the endpoint
* How to find a faulty PR on web repo (some HC queries)
{panel}

issues.description:
The {{deliveryInterval}} field, submitted on {{/api/plans/${planId}/changePlanDeliveryDetails}} conflicts with CDPS cadence values.

We use it in settings ‚Üí edit delivery address flow ([hook|https://github.com/hellofresh/web/blob/5bb2e3575abcaf8fa245b070a7ffade69d2e0a4f/app/spaces/whitelabel/modules/whitelabel-web/packages/pages/settings/src/components/EditDeliveryAddress/hooks/useAddressSave.js#L135]), simply resubmitting whatever we have on the subscription. On other markets (mealkits and rte), this might be used for setting alternative cadence in cancellation deflection.

We need to implement a config, that for GoodChop we‚Äôll conditionally:

* Either remove the {{deliveryInterval}} field from the payload
* Or submit the {{subscription.endless_pause_interval}} value

- Test Execution Time: Avoid making assumptions about specific times in tests. Test scenarios should be designed to handle different time frames and dynamically adapt to the current date/time. This approach increases the flexibility and resilience of the tests.

issues.summary: [Checkout/Delivery] Integrate Address Persistence into Delivery Page
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*Description*

Integrate the OTP address-saving hook into the Delivery page component to enable address persistence for One-Time Purchase (OTP) products. This runs *alongside* the existing Redux flow and ensures address IDs are available for OTP order submission.

*Background:*

* This builds on the hook created in [https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/browse/GOC-3350|https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/browse/GOC-3350|smart-link] 
* *Integration must not break existing checkout flow for subscription products*
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
*Technical Notes*

* Main file: {{app/spaces/whitelabel/modules/whitelabel-web/packages/pages/checkout/src/pages/Delivery.tsx}}
* *Integration Points:*
** Call the hook when the user clicks "Next"
** Extract address data from form state
** Trigger address saving before or during page transition
** Stores returned address IDs in the respective Jotai atoms
** Ensure no conflicts with existing Redux address-saving flow and this runs alongside existing Redux flow, not as a replacement
* *Error Handling:*
** Log errors but don't block checkout flow
** Ensure page transition works even if OTP address save fails
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
*Acceptance criteria:*

* Customer Address save hook triggered appropriately on form submission/next click
* Address IDs stored in {{wlShippingAddressIdAtom}} and {{wlBillingAddressIdAtom}}
* Integration only affects carts with OTP products
* Normal checkout flow for subscriptions unaffected
* Page transitions work correctly for both OTP and subscription flows
* No duplicate API calls or infinite loops
* Errors are logged but don't block checkout
* Integration tested with both OTP and non-OTP carts
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#fffae6}
*Test Scenarios*

*Scenario 1: OTP Product Checkout - Full Flow*

* *Given* a cart contains an OTP product  *When* the user fills in the address form with valid data *And* the user clicks "Next" *Then* the OTP address-saving hook is triggered *And* tw

*Hook Name:* {{useOrderConfirmationData}}

*Location:* {{app/spaces/whitelabel/modules/whitelabel-web/packages/components/my-deliveries-components/src/pages/loading-subscription-content/order-confirmation/hooks/useOneTimeOrderConfirmationData.ts}}

{code:json}//Path Parameters

//Query Parameters
"locale": "en-US" //set by default
"country": "US" //set by default
"brand": "goodchop" {code}

*Hook Structure*
The {{useOneTimeOrderConfirmationData}} hook returns a UI-optimized object with:

* *Core Data (ready to display):*
** {{recipes}} - Flat array of transformed recipes with images, names & quantities
** {{deliveryDate}} - ISO date string for delivery
** {{orderId}} - The order identifier
** {{price}} - price information including item_total_price, shipping _price &_ grand_total
* *Additional Info:*
** {{deliveryAddress}} - City, street, and postcode
* *State Flags:*
** {{isLoading}} - True while fetching data
** {{isError}} - True if any API call failed
** {{isEmpty}} - True when no recipes (after loading)
** {{hasOrderId}} - True when orderId is available
** {{error}} - Error object for debugging

issues.description:
Quarantined System
Spec: checkoutWithOrderConfirmation.spec.ts
https://github.com/hellofresh/web/pull/61230
160 test runs, 157 test failures, 12 test retries, 2.00% test success rate

Quarantine System is a system that is used to prevent flaky tests from being executed. It is designed to be used in conjunction with the following best practices:
- Test data is not deterministic: Avoid relying solely on random values for testing. Instead, consider using deterministic test data that consistently align with the expected outcomes. This approach ensures more predictable and reliable test results.
- DOM Selector Reliability: Pay attention to the reliability of DOM selectors used in tests. Duplicate selectors or selectors that appear after a delay can lead to flaky tests. Aim to use unique and stable selectors to ensure consistent test behavior.
- Test Execution Time: Avoid making assumptions about specific times in tests. Test scenarios should be designed to handle different time frames and dynamically adapt to the current date/time. This approach increases the flexibility and resilience of the tests.
- Following the Cypress best practices https://docs.cypress.io/guides/references/best-practices

You can use the https://github.com/hellofresh/web/pull/61230 to revert the changes and add your fixes to the spec.

Find more information about the quarantined system here: https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/FI/pages/3949987114/Reduce+the+flakiness+for+web+tests

You can also reach out to the team at #good-chop-alerts or #squad-web-foundation s to discuss the quarantined system.

issues.summary: [Checkout/Payment] Skip PCS Call for OTP Products
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*Description*

Modify the Payment page to skip the Pre-Checkout Selection (PCS) API call when the cart contains an OTP product. OTP products use a different cart creation flow and don't need the PCS call, which is designed for subscription products. This prevents unnecessary API calls and potential data conflicts.

*Background:*

* PCS (Pre-Checkout Selection) saves meal selections and add-ons for subscription products
* Currently called in Payment.js via {{savePreCheckoutProducts()}} hook
* OTP products have their own cart creation endpoint that includes product selections
* Calling both PCS and OTP cart creation causes duplicate/conflicting data saves
* PCS should only run for subscription products, not OTP products
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
*Technical Notes*

* PCS endpoint: documented in {{useSavePreCheckoutProducts.ts}}
* OTP detection: use same [https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/browse/GOC-3194|https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/browse/GOC-3194|smart-link] hook
* This change is defensive - prevents accidental PCS calls for OTP
* PCS might not fail for OTP, but it's unnecessary and confusing
* Keep existing PCS error handling for subscription products
* Consider adding feature flag if needed for rollback
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
*Acceptance criteria:*

* PCS call skipped when hasOTPInCart is true
* PCS call still executes for non-OTP (subscription) products
* No breaking changes to existing subscription checkout
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#fffae6}
*Test Scenarios*

*Scenario 1: OTP Product - PCS Skipped*

* *Given* cart contains OTP SKU (e.g., {{MR-OTP1-6-1-0}}) *When* payment page loads *And* {{enablePreCheckoutSelectionUsingPCS}} is true *Then* {{hasOTPInCart}} is true *And* PCS call is NOT made *And* no PCS API request in network tab

*Scenario 2: Subscription Product - PCS Runs*

* *Given* cart contains subscription SKU (e.g., {{MR-CBT1-6-1-0}}) *And* payment page loads *And* {{enablePreCheckoutSelectionUsingPCS}} is true *T
